utils.csv2phdl
Class Main

java.lang.Object
  utils.csv2phdl.Main

public class Main
extends java.lang.Object

This program reads Xilinx Comma Separated Value, csv, files and generates customized component declaration and instantiation templates for use in printed circuit HDL designs.

Author:
pedro

PrintInstantiation

public static void PrintInstantiation(java.util.TreeMap SigHash,
                                      java.util.TreeMap PowHash,
                                      java.util.TreeMap UnusedHash)
This procedure prints out a component instantiation template for the convenience of the PHDL board designer. Paste the instantiation template into your PHDL code and wire it up by editing the actuals.

Parameters:
SigHash - This is the hash table of hash tables that holds the signal pins derived from the FPGA design.
PowHash - This is the hash table of hash tables that holds the power and dedicated pins of the FPGA.
UnusedHash - This is the hash table of hash tables that holds the unused I/O pins of the FPGA.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException
Main() parses the input CSV file and generates the component declaration and instantiation template. First the entire CSV table is read into an array of strings using com.Ostermiller.util.CSVParser. Columns 0 through 15 are defined as follows. Pin Number,Signal Name, Pin Usage,Pin Name,Direction,IO Standard,IO Bank Number,Drive (mA),Slew Rate,Termination,IOB Delay,Voltage,Constraint,IO Register,Signal Integrity Then let's find all the unique signal identifiers. We need a little logic to decide what to do with the signal. If there is a non-null string in column 1 then the signal comes from the compiled FPGA design. Vector signals from the compiled design should be combined into a single HDL component pin. Next we can look for "UNUSED" in column 4. Unused pins could be left off the component definition or just appended to the bottom of the file for convenience. For now we append. Otherwise, we should look to see if it is a power or ground pin by looking in column 3. Power and grounds can be found in column 3 and need to be grouped, ie we want pin [83:0] GND, pin [5:0] VCCO_3, ... This program works by building an informal AST by constructing a hash tables of hash tables. The top hash tables, SigHash and PowHash use the name of the component pin as the key. The value that goes into SigHash is another hash table that contains the list of physical fpga pins that make up the HDL component pin. The physical pins within a vector pin must be sorted using a special hash sort so that they are in the correct order, ie: pin [15:0] DQ "AJ7, Y14, K17, ..."

Parameters:
args - arg[0] is the input filename.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException
java.io.IOException
